results.title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include three found-footage oddities and thrillers about a contagion and a kidnapping that are not what they seem.

results.title: Regina Hall Sees the Bigger Picture With ‘Sleepless in Seattle’ and ‘Forensic Files’
results.abstract: The actress, who stars in “Honk for Jesus. Save Your Soul,” explains what it’s like to inhabit a role and the family heirloom that goes wherever she is.
des_facet: Honk for Jesus. Save Your Soul (Movie)

results.title: MoviePass Is Relaunching Next Month After Failing in 2019
results.abstract: The company was driven out of business three years ago after offering customers a too-good-to-be-true subscription model.

multimedia.caption: A MoviePass user showing his ticket on the app in 2018. The service plans to relaunch next month.
multimedia.copyright: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

results.title: The Reinvention of Aubrey Plaza
results.abstract: The actress, well known for her deadpan comic role on “Parks and Recreation,” brings nuance to her dramatic role in the thriller “Emily the Criminal.”

multimedia.caption: Aubrey Plaza in “Emily the Criminal.”
Aubrey Plaza in “Emily the Criminal.”
Aubrey Plaza in “Emily the Criminal.”

results.title: Rewriting Women Back Into Film History
results.abstract: In shorts from the early 20th century, the stars defy gender stereotypes that would later be standard in Hollywood, as a museum series and box set make clear.

multimedia.caption: In “Mary Jane’s Mishap,” a maid self-destructs, something of a theme in the box set’s films.
In “Mary Jane’s Mishap,” a maid self-destructs, something of a theme in the box set’s films.
In “Mary Jane’s Mishap,” a maid self-destructs, something of a theme in the box set’s films.

results.title: Community Filmmaking in the Amazon
results.abstract: Five questions for Alex Pritz about his documentary “The Territory,” about the fight to preserve the Amazon rainforest.

multimedia.caption: Bitaté Uru Eu Wau Wau, right, leading a surveillance team in the documentary “The Territory.”
Bitaté Uru Eu Wau Wau, right, leading a surveillance team in the documentary “The Territory.”

results.title: Watch a Tense Pool Scene From ‘Bodies Bodies Bodies’
results.abstract: The director Halina Reijn narrates a sequence from her thriller featuring Amandla Stenberg and Maria Bakalova.

multimedia.caption: Amandla Stenberg, left, and Maria Bakalova in “Bodies Bodies Bodies.”

results.title: ‘Beast’ Review: An Angry Lion, but More Bore Than Roar
results.abstract: In this action dud, Idris Elba plays a grieving father who takes his kids on a family trip to South Africa, where they meet one very big C.G.I. animal.

multimedia.caption: Idris Elba as Nate in “Beast,” directed by Baltasar Kormakur.
Idris Elba as Nate in “Beast,” directed by Baltasar Kormakur.
Idris Elba as Nate in “Beast,” directed by Baltasar Kormakur.

results.title: Review: ‘Dragon Ball Super: Super Hero’ Is Deluxe Fan Service
results.abstract: In the latest “Dragon Ball” outing, directed by Tetsuro Kodama and written by the series creator, Akira Toriyama, the menacing villain is a pair of state-of-the-art androids.

multimedia.caption: The battles in “Dragon Ball” have always been drawn and staged with thrilling gusto. In “Dragon Ball Super: Super Hero,” they look better than ever.
The battles in “Dragon Ball” have always been drawn and staged with thrilling gusto. In “Dragon Ball Super: Super Hero,” they look better than ever.
The battles in “Dragon Ball” have always been drawn and staged with thrilling gusto. In “Dragon Ball Super: Super Hero,” they look better than ever.

results.title: ‘Samaritan’ Review: Taking Out the Trash
results.abstract: In this action film from Julius Avery, Sylvester Stallone stars as a sanitation worker who may be a superhero.

multimedia.caption: Javon Walton and Sylvester Stallone in “Samaritan.”
Javon Walton and Sylvester Stallone in “Samaritan.”
Javon Walton and Sylvester Stallone in “Samaritan.”

results.title: ‘Funny Pages’ Review: Ordinary Life, Complex Stuff
results.abstract: Owen Kline’s wonderful feature debut about an aspiring comic-book creator delves into a buzzingly alive, if anxious, world of cartooning.

multimedia.caption: In “Funny Pages,” Daniel Zolghadri plays a young cartoonist, who, though desperate for validation, seems to despise almost everyone.
In “Funny Pages,” Daniel Zolghadri plays a young cartoonist, who, though desperate for validation, seems to despise almost everyone.
In “Funny Pages,” Daniel Zolghadri plays a young cartoonist, who, though desperate for validation, seems to despise almost everyone.

results.title: ‘Three Thousand Years of Longing’ Review: Desire, Once Upon a Time
results.abstract: George Miller directs a visually sumptuous, grown-up fairy tale with Tilda Swinton and Idris Elba. It jumps across time but too often just stumbles.
des_facet: The Djinn in the Nightingales Eye (Book)

results.title: ‘Seoul Vibe’ Review: Grinding Gears
results.abstract: Set in 1988, this Korean action comedy follows a blithe driving team that goes undercover with holdovers from the old military leadership.

multimedia.caption: From left, Park Ju-hyun, Yoo Ah-in, Lee Kyoo-hyung and Ong Seong-wu in “Seoul Vibe.”

results.title: ‘Private Desert’ Review: Into the Valley of Repression
results.abstract: This L.G.B.T.Q. drama from Brazil follows a distraught police academy instructor with a history of violence as he searches for his mysterious online girlfriend.

multimedia.caption: Thomas Aquino, left, with Pedro Fasanaro in “Private Desert.”
Thomas Aquino, left, with Pedro Fasanaro in “Private Desert.”
Thomas Aquino, left, with Pedro Fasanaro in “Private Desert.”

results.title: ‘Adieu Godard’ Review: A Poor Imitation
results.abstract: This limp satire about an Indian villager’s encounter with the movies of Jean-Luc Godard rehashes regressive stereotypes and squanders a potent premise.

multimedia.caption: Choudhury Bikash Das plays Ananda, an Indian villager who becomes enamored with the cinema of Jean-Luc Godard and organizes a French film festival.
Choudhury Bikash Das plays Ananda, an Indian villager who becomes enamored with the cinema of Jean-Luc Godard and organizes a French film festival.

results.title: ‘Out of the Blue’ Review: The Spider and the Fly
results.abstract: An unhappy wife leads her younger lover down a dangerous path in this sexy, yet predictable drama from Neil LaBute.

multimedia.caption: Ray Nicholson and Diane Kruger in “Out of the Blue.”
Ray Nicholson and Diane Kruger in “Out of the Blue.”
Ray Nicholson and Diane Kruger in “Out of the Blue.”

results.title: ‘The Good Boss’ Review: Company Man
results.abstract: As the titular boss of this dark comedy from Spain, Javier Bardem engages in underhanded tactics to win an award for business excellence.

Javier Bardem in “The Good Boss.”
Javier Bardem in “The Good Boss.”

results.title: ‘Adopting Audrey’ Review: Building a New Home Out of Nothing
results.abstract: Jena Malone plays a young woman who’s seeking to be adopted by a gruff patriarch. Deep down, he has, you guessed it, a heart of gold.

multimedia.caption: Jena Malone and Robert Hunger-Bühler in “Adopting Audrey,” directed by M. Cahill.
Jena Malone and Robert Hunger-Bühler in “Adopting Audrey,” directed by M. Cahill.

results.title: ‘Breaking’ Review: A Bank Holdup by an Ex-Marine, for Benefits
results.abstract: John Boyega plays a veteran at the end of his rope in this fact-based story of grievance and hostage-taking.

multimedia.caption: John Boyega in “Breaking,” directed by Abi Damaris Corbin.
John Boyega in “Breaking,” directed by Abi Damaris Corbin.

results.title: ‘Alienoid’ Review: Sorcerers, Alien Prisoners and Much, Much More
results.abstract: This bonkers Korean movie could not pick just one cinematic genre, so it went for half a dozen of them at once.

results.title: Can a Start-Up Help the Film and TV Industry Reduce Their Carbon Footprint?
results.abstract: The global entertainment industry generates millions of metric tons of carbon dioxide a year. A Spanish director has set up a company to try to cut that number substantially.

multimedia.caption: Eduardo Vieitez, a Spanish film and advertising director and the creator of the Creast app, which is designed to help productions reduce their carbon footprints.
multimedia.copyright: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

results.title: Gary Gaines, Coach of ‘Friday Night Lights’ Fame, Dies at 73
results.abstract: He coached the Permian High School Panthers in Odessa, Texas, for four seasons in the 1980s, including the one that became the subject of a best-selling book.

multimedia.caption: Gary Gaines, the head coach of the Permian High School Panthers, at a practice in 2009, the year he returned to Permian. He had a 46-7-1 record there in the 1980s, but he was less successful the second time around.

Gary Gaines, the head coach of the Permian High School Panthers, at a practice in 2009, the year he returned to Permian. He had a 46-7-1 record there in the 1980s, but he was less successful the second time around.

results.title: ‘Katrina Babies’ Review: Hearing From Survivors
results.abstract: Edward Buckles Jr.’s intimate documentary sheds light on the experiences of Black children when Hurricane Katrina struck New Orleans.

multimedia.caption: New Orleans in 2005. “Katrina Babies” shows the devastating effects of the hurricane on the people who lived there.
New Orleans in 2005. “Katrina Babies” shows the devastating effects of the hurricane on the people who lived there.
New Orleans in 2005. “Katrina Babies” shows the devastating effects of the hurricane on the people who lived there.

results.title: Joanne Koch, Who Led Lincoln Center’s Film Society, Dies at 92
results.abstract: A lifelong film lover, she stood up to protesters, and to federal and church authorities, to bring challenging movies to the masses.
org_facet: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts

multimedia.caption: Joanne Koch in 1989 in her office at the Film Society of Lincoln Center. She led the society for more than a quarter-century.
Joanne Koch in 1989 in her office at the Film Society of Lincoln Center. She led the society for more than a quarter-century.
Joanne Koch in 1989 in her office at the Film Society of Lincoln Center. She led the society for more than a quarter-century.

results.title: Kate Berlant Can’t Hide Any Longer
results.abstract: The experimental comic is known for freewheeling sets. Then Bo Burnham asked, “What if you actually tried to make something?” The transition has been hard.

multimedia.caption: “It would be funny if this show is so bad,” Kate Berlant said about her new solo play, which plays with solo-play tropes.
multimedia.copyright: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times

results.title: More Than ‘Weird’: Roku Embraces Original Programming
results.abstract: The streaming media device company wants to attract more viewers and advertisers to its channel. A coming biopic of “Weird Al” Yankovic is its most ambitious project to date.

multimedia.caption: Quinta Brunson as Oprah Winfrey and Daniel Radcliffe as “Weird Al” Yankovic in “Weird,” which will be available on Roku in November.

results.title: Gary Busey Faces Sex Charges After Appearance at Film Convention
results.abstract: The actor, 78, was a featured guest at Monster-Mania Con in Cherry Hill, N.J. He was charged with two counts of criminal sexual contact, among other counts, the police said.

multimedia.caption: The actor Gary Busey, who earned an Oscar nomination for his role in the 1978 film “The Buddy Holly Story,” was charged on Saturday, the police said.
multimedia.copyright: Chris Maggio for The New York Times

results.title: Gene LeBell, 89, Judo Champion, Wrestler and Star Stuntman, Dies
results.abstract: A tough guy who got beaten up by the likes of John Wayne, he had a bottom-line view of his job: “The more you get hit in the nose, the richer you are.”

multimedia.caption: The Hollywood stuntman Gene LeBell in the 1950s, when he was a professional wrestler. He had earlier been an American Amateur Union judo champion.
The Hollywood stuntman Gene LeBell in the 1950s, when he was a professional wrestler. He had earlier been an American Amateur Union judo champion.
The Hollywood stuntman Gene LeBell in the 1950s, when he was a professional wrestler. He had earlier been an American Amateur Union judo champion.

results.title: The True Legacy of Michael K. Williams
results.abstract: The actor set out to save his Brooklyn neighborhood. Here’s how he’s doing it, even in death.

multimedia.caption: Michael K. Williams at Domino Park in Brooklyn at a We Build the Block family day picnic in August 2020.
Michael K. Williams at Domino Park in Brooklyn at a We Build the Block family day picnic in August 2020.

results.title: Trisha Brown on the Beach: Catch a Wave of Dancing Bliss
results.abstract: This year, the Beach Sessions at Rockaway Beach features the Trisha Brown Dance Company in a program of early works.
results.byline: By Gia Kourlas and Angelo Silvio Vasta For The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Territory’ Review: Saving the Amazon, One Camera at a Time
results.abstract: This documentary is a thrilling look at an Indigenous group’s fight to keep illegal settlers from destroying their land in the Amazon rainforest.

multimedia.caption: Bitaté, the young leader of the Uru Eu Wau Wau, in “The Territory.”
multimedia.copyright: Alex Pritz/Amazon Land Documentary/National Geographic Documentary Films

results.title: ‘Delia’s Gone’ Review: A False Conviction in a Hardscrabble Town
results.abstract: A man aims to find his sister’s real killer.

multimedia.caption: Stephan James in “Delia’s Gone,” a film directed by Robert Budreau.
Stephan James in “Delia’s Gone,” a film directed by Robert Budreau.

results.title: ‘Three Minutes: A Lengthening’ Review: A Ghost Story
results.abstract: Using footage from a three-minute amateur movie shot in 1938, this rousing documentary about a Jewish town in Poland is a haunting meditation on the memory of the Holocaust.

multimedia.caption: Footage from the three-minute home movie that serves as the basis for the documentary “Three Minutes: A Lengthening.”
multimedia.copyright: Family Affair Films, US Holocaust Memorial Museum. /Super Ltd
